page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: The area under Survey is administered by Gloucestershire and the County of Hereford and Worcester. At the lowest tier of administration there are 7 parishes: The Lea, Weston under Penyard, Hope Mansell, Drybrook, Mitcheldean, Longhope and Aston Ingham. Just over 25% is on a forested plateau which is part of The Royal Forest of Dean. Of the remaining area 70% is undulating farmland. There are only 2 main residential areas yet there are small scattered hamlets, farmhouses and cottages across the whole spectrum many in complete isolation. The village of The Lea is the only community that has the characteristic features of rural life, namely, Parish Church,Village School and an Inn.
